perturbation.original_text: 4.2.22 allow preferred Transportation of Crude Oil to refineries in order to satisfy the country's needs and avoid a national shortage pursuant to  article 58 of the petroleum code.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2.22 The Transporter is not obligated to give preferred Transportation of Crude Oil to refineries.
perturbation.explanation: Clause 4.2.22 originally says to allow preference to domestic refineries to avoid shortages. The modified version directly contradicts this by stating that the transporter is not obligated to give preferred transportation to crude oil, introducing uncertainty about the obligation.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1 The minimum values of quality that the Crude delivered by the Senders must have to be accepted for Transportation in the Pipeline are:

   For specific systems the Transporter defines minimum parameters for quality which are listed in Annex 4 Minimum Quality Specifications by  System.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1 The minimum values of quality that the Crude delivered by the Senders must have to be accepted for Transportation in the Pipeline are:
 The Transporter can accept any quality of crude regardless of the system.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that there are minimum requirements in quality for the transportation but the new text contradicts this statement by saying that any quality is accepted. The requirements are now not clear.

perturbation.original_text:
19.1 It is the necessary volume to fill the Pipeline between the initial pumping station and the final station, the non-pumping bottom of the storage  tanks of the Pipeline, and all installations, tubes, equipment, pumping and measuring accessories.

19.2 For the Pipeline Operation, the Transporter may request to each Sender, including the ANH, to deliver to the Transporter the necessary  quantity of Hydrocarbon to fill in the line of the Pipeline.
perturbation.changed_text:
19.1 It is the necessary volume to fill the Pipeline between the initial pumping station and the final station, the non-pumping bottom of the storage  tanks of the Pipeline, and all installations, tubes, equipment, pumping and measuring accessories.

19.2 For the Pipeline Operation, the Transporter is solely responsible for the necessary quantity of Hydrocarbon to fill in the line of the Pipeline.
perturbation.explanation: The original text says that the transporter may ask to the senders the quantity needed to fill the pipeline but the new version says that the transporter is responsible, now the entity responsible to take care of the volume is not clear.
